glsa.title: Openswan: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in the pluto IKE daemon of Openswan might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service.

background.p: Openswan is an implementation of IPsec for Linux.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Openswan:

ul.li: Gerd v. Egidy reported a NULL pointer dereference in the Dead Peer Detection of the pluto IKE daemon as included in Openswan (CVE-2009-0790).
The Orange Labs vulnerability research team discovered multiple vulnerabilities in the ASN.1 parser (CVE-2009-2185).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending specially crafted R_U_THERE or R_U_THERE_ACK packets, or a specially crafted X.509 certificate containing a malicious Relative Distinguished Name (RDN), UTCTIME string or GENERALIZEDTIME string to cause a Denial of Service of the pluto IKE daemon.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
